Name: PKX Extraction
Description: This application allows the user to extract Pokémon data from RAM dumps. Users of this application have used it to discover previously unknown aspects of Pokémon games, recover lost data, research what data is stored in the RAM, and preserve data that would have otherwise been lost to time.

Name: Game Clock
Description: A Fitbit watch face made with Pesona 5 in mind. The clock displays the current hour, minute, second, day, month, and year. In addition the display shows a battery meter so the user always know the charge level of their Fitbit.

Name: Portfolio Website
Description: In order to better describe myself and show my work I made this website. Here my academic, career, and personal endeavours are placed on display.

Name: Store-Project
Description: Developed while taking ICT 711. This desktop program tracks employee sales, inventory in stock, store front transactions and store data in a JSON file. Developed using C# and .NET.

Name: Contact-Organizer
Description: Developed while taking ICT 712. This desktop application allows the user to add, remove and edit contact lists and store the data in either a JSON file or to an SQL database.

Name: Notes Website
Description: Developed while taking ICT 713. This web based application lets the user to write a note and store it in an SQL database. Notes can be organized by their type and filtered to find the note the user is looking for.

Name: Rock Blaster
Description: Developed while experimenting with Unity. This game is a basic asteroid rail shooter.

Name: School Manager
Description: Developed while taking ICT 710. This desktop application allows for the user to create, load, edit, and manage student information relevant to an education institution.
